document.docAuthor: Jung, Tae Won & Yoon, Seong Myeong
document.docTitle: Parvipalpus holocaudatus Jung & Yoon 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New records of Nuuanuidae (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Senticaudata) from Korean waters, with descriptions of one new genus and two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New records of Nuuanuidae (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Senticaudata) from Korean waters, with descriptions of one new genus and two new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: National Marine Biodiversity Institute of Korea, Seocheon, Korea;
Department of Biology, Chosun University, Gwangju, Korea

subSubSection.paragraph: (Korean Name: Ga-neun-chae-jjik-yeop-sae-u, new)

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype .
Adult male, 4.0 mm, dissected on slide glasses, NIBRIV0000305388, Beom Island , Seogwipo-si , Jeju-do , Korea ( 33°13′39″N , 126°34′03″E ),
20 November 2008
, SCUBA diving (depth
30 m
), collected by T . W. Jung.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Allotype .
Adult female, 5.5 mm , dissected on slide glasses, NIBRIV0000305389, collection details same as holotype .

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1.
Parvipalpus holocaudatus
sp. nov. , holotype, male. (A) Head; (B) antenna 1; (C) accessory flagellum of antenna 1; (D) antenna 2; (E) upper lip; (F) lower lip; (G) left mandible; (H) incisor of left mandible; (I) right mandible; (J) maxilla 1; (K) apical spines of outer plate on maxilla 1; (L) maxilla 2; (M) inner plate of maxilliped; (N) outer plate of maxilliped; (O) palp of maxilliped.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype , male.
Head ( Figure 1A ), rostrum minute; anterior cephalic lobe obtuse subrectangular, antennal sinus not developed and forming small notch anteriorly; eyes hardly developed with separated ommatidia and boundary indistinct.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 2.
Parvipalpus holocaudatus
sp. nov. , holotype, male. (A) Gnathopod 1; (B) coxa of gnathopod 1; (C) distal part of propodus and dactylus of gnathopod 1; (D) coxa 2; (E) gnathopod 2; (F) spines of palm on gnathopod 2.

Figure 3.
Parvipalpus holocaudatus
sp. nov. , holotype, male. (A) Pereopod 3; (B) right pereopod 4; (C) left pereopod 4; (D) pereopod 5; (E) pereopod 6; (F) pereopod 7.

Figure 4.
Parvipalpus holocaudatus
sp. nov. , holotype, male (A–I) and allotype, female (J). (A) Pleonal epimera; (B–D) pleopods 1–3; (E) uropod 1; (F) uropod 2; (G) right uropod 3; (H) left uropod 3; (I) telson; (J) pleon and urosome.

Figure 5.
Parvipalpus holocaudatus
sp. nov. , allotype, female. (A) Coxa 1; (B) gnathopod 1; (C) palm of gnathopod 1; (D) gnathopod 2; (E) palm of gnathopod 2; (F–J) coxal gills of gnathopod 2 to pereopod 5; (K–M) oostegites on pereopods 3 to 5.

subSubSection.paragraph: Antenna 1 ( Figure 1B, C ) longer than antenna 2; peduncular article 1 somewhat convex and robust; peduncular article 2 elongate, subequal to peduncular article 1, and slightly concave mesially; peduncular article 3 as long as 0.42 times peduncular article 2, with accessory flagellum distally; accessory flagellum 4-articulate, distal one considerably reduced, distal margins of each article with several setae; flagellum longer than peduncular articles 1 – 3 combined and 22-articulate, each article with several setae distally; calceoli, aesthetasc absent.

Allotype , female.
Gnathopod 1 (
Figure 5A – C
) similar to that of male except for numbers and positions of setae.

The composite epithet of the specific name,
holocaudatus
, is a combination of the Greek holos and the Latin cauda , meaning ‘ entire tail ’ . This name refers to the shape of the telson, which is not cleft.

This new species,
P. holocaudatus
shows similar shapes of propodus and dactylus on gnathopod 2 in mature males to
Gammarella berringar ( Barnard, 1974 )
and
Nuuanu merringannee ( Barnard, 1974 )
, but it is distinguished readily from
G. berringar
by the following characters: dorsal keel of urosomite 1 is absent; uropod 3 is more reduced; and telson is entire in
P. holocaudatus
. The new species can also be discriminated from
N. merringannee
by bi-articulate mandibular palp, produced anteroventral corner on pleonal epimeron 1, uni-articulate outer ramus of the uropod 3, and entire telson.
